name: Westmark Whitehorse Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.text: This hotel is in downtown Whitehorse. The hotel is owned by Holland America so it caters to the Alaska cruise line crowd, and as a result, it's over-priced and tries to be a high-end hotel but it clearly isn't. We paid $134 for a double-room at end of July and it was not worth the money. The rooms are renovated but small. Ask for a room on the third-floor--the rooms there are nicer. The staff aren't overly friendly but okay. The restaurant is good but again, overpriced and crowded. There's a free internet kiosk in the lobby and a small gift shop onsite. I would shop around for another hotel in Whitehorse (try the High Country Inn)--the Westmark is over-priced and just doesn't go out of its way to make you feel welcome.
reviews.title: Overpriced hotel but clean and comfortable

description: Located in the heart of downtown, within blocks of area restaurants, night-spots, shopping and government offices, the Westmark Whitehorse Hotel & Conference Center is the Yukon's premier hotel and conference center. Recently renovated, the Westmark Whitehorse offers 180 first-class guest rooms and suites, conference facilities and professional special event catering. The Westmark Whitehorse is the largest hotel in Yukon and features over 7000 square feet of meeting space. The Steele Street Restaurant & Lounge serves up a fabulous menu and offers daily lunch and dinner specials.
